required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sustained Aeration of Infant Lungs Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Sustained Aeration of Infant Lungs Trial

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is a 2-arm randomized, controlled, multi-center clinical trial to determine which of two strategies at birth are best to optimally aerate the lung of preterm infants. Specifically we will determine in 600 infants of 23-26 weeks gestational age (GA) requiring respiratory support at birth which of two lung opening strategies - either a standard PEEP/CPAP of 5-7 cm H2O in the delivery room (DR), as compared to early lung recruitment using Sustained Inflation (SI) in the DR, will result in a lower rate of the combined endpoint of death or bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD) at 36 weeks gestational age.
Hypotheses:
1. Early lung recruitment with SI superimposed upon standard PEEP/CPAP in the DR will reduce the need for mechanical ventilation in the first seven days of life, and reduce need for surfactant use; and
2. A policy of DR SI on standard PEEP/CPAP recruitment will confer better outcomes at 36 weeks post-menstrual age (PMA) than standard PEEP/CPAP

detailed_description.textblock:
The SAIL trial aims to provide evidence for changing policy or standard of care. The context of this trial is an unacceptable rate of poor long-term outcomes of preterm infants born as Extremely Low Gestational Age Newborns (ELGAN) <1000 g birthweight (BW), but especially for those born between 23-26 weeks' gestational age (GA). Such infants are the most vulnerable and immature in all organ systems, including the lungs and the brain. These infants are at high risk of death and bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD) during their initial hospitalization, neurodevelopmental impairment (NDI) and pulmonary problems in infancy and childhood.
The SAIL trial focuses on facilitating the difficult transition of these most vulnerable infants from a liquid filled in-utero lung to an ex-utero air-filled lung. Sustained Inflation (SI) is a promising delivery room (DR) intervention, with evidence of short-term efficacy with minimal risk of additional harm beyond current standard accepted Newborn Resuscitation Program (NRP) Guidelines. This protocol proposes a fully informed consenting procedure. We propose to evaluate the impact of a SI in the DR on the need for mechanical ventilation in the first week of life which would also impact mortality rates and the incidence and severity of BPD.

primary_outcome.measure: Combined Outcome of Death or Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia
primary_outcome.description: To determine in infants born at 23-26 weeks gestational age requiring respiratory support at birth, which of two treatment strategies when compared, results in a lower rate of the combined endpoint of death or bronchopulmonary dysplasia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxygen Profile Over First 24 Hours
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen profile over first 24 hours post delivery room using hourly FiO2 records

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxygen Profile With Highest FiO2 Level up to 48 Hours
secondary_outcome.description: Highest FiO2 level recorded during the first 48 hours post DR

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart Rate in the Delivery Room (DR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First 30 seconds of life in DR
secondary_outcome.description: Categorical variable with 3 levels: <60, 60-100, >100

secondary_outcome.measure: Detailed Status on Departure From the Delivery Room (DR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Resuscitation time will vary - 1 to 30 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Type of respiratory support (CPAP, PPV) and Fraction of Inspired Oxygen (FiO2) on departure from DR

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of Inotropes on Arrival in NICU
secondary_outcome.description: Circulatory support post-delivery room

secondary_outcome.measure: Need for Intubation in Delivery Room
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First 30 seconds to 24 hours of life
secondary_outcome.description: Need for intubation in delivery room during the first 30 seconds to 24 hours of age

secondary_outcome.measure: Pressure-volume Characteristics in the Delivery Room (DR)
secondary_outcome.description: Pressure-volume characteristics in the Delivery room (DR) expected within 30 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Pneumothorax or New Chest Drains in the First 48 Hours of Life
secondary_outcome.description: Chest x-ray reports showing pneumothorax or new chest drains in the first 48 hours of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Any Chest Drain In-situ Post-DR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During hospitalization - up to 36 weeks Post Menstrual Age (PMA)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of any chest drain in-situ post-DR during hospitalization - up to 36 weeks Post Menstrual Age (PMA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraventricular Hemorrhage by All Grades
secondary_outcome.description: Head ultrasound and/or MRI findings of intraventricular hemorrhage by all grades focusing on grades 3 and 4 by 48 hour and by day 10

secondary_outcome.measure: Chest X-ray Between Days 7-10
secondary_outcome.description: Chest x-ray between the first 7-10 days of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Death or Need for Positive Pressure Ventilation
secondary_outcome.description: Death or need for positive pressure ventilation during the first 7 days of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Highest FiO2 and Area Under the FiO2 Curve for the First Week of Life
secondary_outcome.description: Highest FiO2 and Area under the FiO2 curve during the first 7 days of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Pneumothorax and Pulmonary Interstitial Emphysema (PIE)
secondary_outcome.description: Pneumothorax and pulmonary interstitial emphysema (PIE) during the first 10 days of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Survival to Discharge Home Without BPD, Retinopathy of Prematurity (Grades 3 & 4), or Significant Brain Abnormalities on Head Ultrasound
secondary_outcome.description: Survival to discharge home without BPD, retinopathy of prematurity (grades 3 & 4), or significant brain abnormalities on head ultrasound with an expected discharge between 36-40 weeks PMA

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Respiratory Support (Ventilation, CPAP, Supplemental Oxygen)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During hospitalization - up to 36 weeks Post Menstrual Age (PMA)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of respiratory support (ventilation, CPAP, supplemental oxygen) during hospitalization upto 36 weeks Post Menstrual Age (PMA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Death in Hospital
secondary_outcome.description: Death in hospital during expected hospitalization of 23-40 weeks PMA

secondary_outcome.measure: Retinopathy of Prematurity (ROP) Stage 3 or Greater Requiring Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Retinopathy of prematurity (ROP) stage 3 or greater requiring treatment at 36 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of Postnatal Steroids for Treatment of BPD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During hospitalization - up to 36 weeks Post Menstrual Age (PMA)
secondary_outcome.description: Use of postnatal steroids for treatment of BPD during hospitalization up to 36 weeks Post Menstrual Age (PMA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of Hospital Stay
secondary_outcome.description: Length of hospital stay with average discharge between 36-40 weeks PMA

secondary_outcome.measure: Neurodevelopmental and Respiratory Outcome at 22-26 Months Corrected Gestational Age
secondary_outcome.description: Neurodevelopmental and respiratory outcome at 22-26 months corrected gestational age

arm_group.description: Control Arm-Respiratory support using Standard of Care positive-end expiratory pressure/continuous positive airway pressure (PEEP/CPAP) of 5-7 cm H2O compared to Sustained Inflation intervention
Administer delivery room respiratory support using a Sustained Inflation (SI) intervention and expiratory pressure/continuous positive airway pressure (PEEP/CPAP) of 5-7 cm H2O

intervention.description: The first sustained inflation will use inflation pressure of 20 cm H20 for 15 seconds
Newborn Resuscitation Program (NRP) Guidelines using a standard PEEP/CPAP of 5-7 cm H2O as compared to the Sustained Inflation intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Gestational age (GA) at least 23 weeks but less than 27 completed weeks by best obstetrical estimate
- Requiring resuscitation/respiratory intervention at birth -"apneic, labored breathing, gasping" (as defined in NRP 2011 AAP 6th Edition p.45)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Considered non-viable by the attending neonatologist
- Refusal of antenatal informed consent
- Known major anomalies, pulmonary hypoplasia
- Mothers who are unable to consent for their medical care and who do not have a surrogate guardian will not be approached for consent

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
